clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Acetylcysteine is used mainly as a mucolytic and in the management of paracetamol acetaminophen overdose

contraindications.disease: Single intravenous doses of acetylcysteine at 1000 mg kg in mice 2445 mg kg in rats 1500 mg kg in guinea pigs 1200 mg kg in rabbits and 500 mg kg in dogs were lethal Symptoms of acute toxicity were ataxia hypoactivity labored respiration cyanosis loss of righting reflex and convulsions
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Acetylcysteine has been shown to reduce the extent of liver injury following acetaminophen overdose It is most effective when given early with benefit seen principally in patients treated within 8 10 hours of the overdose Acetylcysteine likely protects the liver by maintaining or restoring the glutathione levels or by acting as an alternate substrate for conjugation with and thus detoxification of the reactive metabolite

incompatibilities.description: The serum concentration of Eluxadoline can be increased when it is combined with Acetylcysteine
The excretion of Pravastatin can be decreased when combined with Acetylcysteine
The excretion of Valsartan can be decreased when combined with Acetylcysteine
The excretion of Erythromycin can be decreased when combined with Acetylcysteine
The excretion of Torasemide can be decreased when combined with Acetylcysteine
